Package com.accele.gage.entity

Class EntityHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.accele.gage.entity.EntityHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cleanable, Renderable, Tickable
    public class EntityHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements Tickable, Renderable, Cleanable
    The EntityHandler class is responsible for managing all instances of Entity used in the engine.

    Entity logic processing, collision detection, and rendering are handled automatically through this class. To use this class in a game, call its tick() and render(Graphics, double) methods in the respective places within a GameState instance. The clean() method is automatically called upon exiting the engine; there is no need to call it manually.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    William Garland

    • Constructor Detail

      • EntityHandler

        public EntityHandler​(GameConfiguration config)
        Creates a new EntityHandler with the specified GameConfiguration.

        This constructor should not be called by the user; the GAGE class already contains an instance of this class.

        Parameters:
        config - the GameConfiguration to use in the EntityHandler
        See Also:
        getEntityHandler()

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Description copied from interface: Tickable
        Called a predetermined number of times per second to update the object. This method is designed to update game logic only and should not be used to modify anything relating to object rendering. getTicksPerSecond() returns the number of times per second this method will be called.
        Specified by:
        tick in interface Tickable
        See Also:
        GameConfiguration

      • render

        public void render​(Graphics g,
                   double interpolation)
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        Called as many times as possible per second to render the object. This method is designed to update object graphics only and should not be used to modify anything relating to object logic. getFps() returns the number of times per second this method will be called.
        Specified by:
        render in interface Renderable
        Parameters:
        g - the instance of Graphics used by the engine to render objects
        interpolation - the normalized difference in time between when the previous frame was called and when this frame was called
        See Also:
        GameConfiguration

      • clean

        public void clean()
        Description copied from interface: Cleanable
        Allows the implementer to perform any necessary cleanup tasks. For most engine-specific resources, this method should not be called manually as it is usually always called after stop() has been called.
        Specified by:
        clean in interface Cleanable

      • addEntity

        public void addEntity​(Entity e)
        Adds an Entity to the EntityHandler.

        This method will wait to add the Entity until the end of the current game loop cycle.

        Parameters:
        e - the Entity to add

      • removeEntity

        public void removeEntity​(Entity e)
        Removes an Entity from the EntityHandler.

        This method will wait to remove the Entity until the end of the current game loop cycle. This method also will not kill the Entity before removing it, so onDeath() will be ignored. To properly kill an entity, use die().

        Parameters:
        e - the Entity to remove
        See Also:
        die()

      • removeAllEntities

        public void removeAllEntities()
        Removes all instances of Entity from the EntityHandler.

        This method will wait to remove the entities until the end of the current game loop cycle. This method also will not kill the entities before removing them, so onDeath() will be ignored. To properly kill an entity, use die().

        See Also:
        die()

      • getEntities

        public java.util.List<Entity> getEntities()
        Returns the list of entities currently in the EntityHandler.
        Returns:
        the list of entities currently in the EntityHandler
